recommendations.recommendation: Easily one of the best final arks I`ve ever seen in shonen. What this show managed to do to me is drive home the direness and urgency of the situation and the scale of enemy`s power, and, believe me, this hardly ever happens. Also, and this, I believe, is a shoutout to Kazuhiro Fujita`s writing, the way everything and everyone that`s appearred in the show ends up being one of a million tiny pieces that build the heroes` success feels refreshing. In two seasons of this show, there`s, in the end, close to no filler material. Give this one a try, it`s worth it.

anime.description: Ushio thinks that his father`s talk of an ancient ancestor impaling a demon on a temple altar stone with the legendary Beast Spear is nuts, but when he finds the monster in his own basement, Ushio has to take another look at the family legend! To save his friends and family from the invading spirits, Ushio is forced to release Tora from his captivity. But will the creature prove to be worse than the curse? Source: ADV Films

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

episode.title: 不帰の旅
The Journey of No Return
Voyage sans retour
Fuki no Tabi
episode.summary: A mysterious ghost appears in front of Atsuzawa and calls herself Jie Mei. She says she has a favor to ask him in regards to Hakumen no Mono... Meanwhile, Ushio and Tora are asked to come meet some people who want to see them. While they are on the way to meet these people, they run into Nagare, and Ushio can`t hide his surprise. The happy reunion is cut short by some shocking news... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三日月の夜
The Night of the Crescent Moon
Nuit de croissant de lune
Mikazuki no Yoru
episode.summary: Mayuko, Kirio, and Kuin are all doing what they can to stop Hakumen no Mono. Meanwhile, Ushio runs into the exorcist, Hyou, again. Because of his magical eye, Hyou did not forget about Ushio`s existence. Hyou comes to visit Ushio at his home, and they encounter azafuses as well as Guren, and learn what Tora might actually be. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もうこぼさない
I Won`t Lose Anyone Else
Je n`abandonnerai plus personne
Mou Kobosanai
episode.summary: Upon getting a premonition that the Beast Spear would break, the yokai chiefs from all over make a collective decision. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風が吹く
The Wind Blows
Le vent se lève
Kaze ga Fuku
episode.summary: Ushio, anxious over the approaching decisive battle with Hakumen, runs into Asako on the way home from school and ends up arguing with her as usual. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とら
Tora
Tora
Tora
episode.summary: Even with the strength of the leader of the East, Sumako, Mayuko, Shigure and the oThther monks, they are no match against Hakumen no Mono. Hakumen no Mono heads toward the main island of Japan from Okinawa for more fear from the humans as well as for destruction. While in the ocean, Ushio begins to dream about a man from long ago. The truth about Hakumen`s birth is finally revealed. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獣の槍破壊
The Beast Spear Destroyed
La destruction de la lance de la bête
Kemono no Yari Hakai
episode.summary: Hakumen no Mono is revived. Hakumen rises from the sea and instantly strikes fear into the hearts of all that sees it. Ushio suddenly becomes filled with hatred, as he finally got to see his mother, and is forced to carry out the cruel fate of wielding the Beast Spear. Despite his mother telling him that he cannot fight Hakumen no Mono with hate, Ushio is overwhelmed by his hatred and attacks. Meanwhile, Hakumen no Mono reveals a secret about Tora... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 母
Mother
Mère
Haha
episode.summary: Ushio heads to the stone pillar in order to save his mother from Hakumen no Mono. He approaches her quietly in the cave and she softly calls his name. They get to share a heartwarming moment together, but then a terrible sound interrupts their reunion. Torpedoes break through the barrier, and then... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 混沌の海へ
To the Sea of Chaos
Vers la mer du chaos
Konton no Umi e
episode.summary: After being tricked by Hakumen no Mono, the JASDF prepare to send subs to destroy the stone pillar where Ushio`s mother is, as she keeps Hakumen sealed. Ushio heads to Okinawa to stop them, but runs into Nagare, who seems to have switched sides. Ushio leaves Nagare to Tora, and hurries to stop the subs. Nagare and Tora go all out in battle, and Asako finds out a secret about Ushio... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うしおととらの縁
The Fate of Ushio and Tora
Le lien qui unit Ushio et Tora
Ushio to Tora no En
episode.summary: Despite its fear toward the Beast Spear, Hakumen no Mono goes in for its final attack against Ushio and Tora. Tora tells Ushio his plan to deal counter Hakumen no Mono`s high-speed attacks. Will the two be able to prevail against Hakumen no Mono in their final battle? Only the fate between Ushio and Tora will be able to tell. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最終局面
The End
Dernière configuration
Saishuu Kyokumen
episode.summary: Trapped inside the barrier, Hakumen no Mono uses poison to chase away the youkai that had entrapped it into the barrier, but Ushio and Tora are protected by their armors. Surrounded by poison, Ushio and Tora`s final battle with Hakumen begins. No matter how many times Hakumen attacks, Ushio keeps fighting, but the effects of overuse of the Beast Spear are starting to show again... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強の悪態
The Ultimate Insult
La pire des injures
Saikyou no Akutai
episode.summary: Hakumen no Mono is cornered and the battle seems to finally be coming to an end. Tora is sinking slowly to the bottom of the ocean, when Mayuko comes to talk to himm and tries to lift his spirits. Tora is able pick himself up and reunites with Ushio and prepares to end the battle with Hakumen no Mono, once and for all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束の夜へ
To the Promised Night
La nuit promise
Yakusoku no Yoru e
episode.summary: The humans and monsters face Hakumen no Mono together. Because they are filled with hope, Hakumen no Mono`s movements get weaker. Surrounded by everyone`s hope, Aotsuki Ushio reemerges wielding the revived Beast Spear. With the sun rising behind him, Ushio faces Hakumen no Mono onc more. Meanwhile, Hyou wakes up in someone`s yard after fighting with Guren. He was in thee middle of his final with his accursed enemy, Guren, and it was finally coming to a close... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望
Hope
Espoir
Kibou
episode.summary: Ushio finds out about everything that happened in the past. Because he doesn`t want anyone else to die, he rises up once again. Hakumen no Mono heads to mainland Japan, bringing chaos wherever it goes, and at the same time, a huge typhoon engulfs all of Japan. The shards of the Beast Spear attacks all of the Hiyou embedded in everyone`s minds, and their memories of Ushio and Tora return. Everyone`s hope is restored, as they know that as long as Ushio and Tora are there, there is hope. Source: crunchyroll
